body_html:
<On my machine, stddef.h can be found at C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.10240.0\ucrt
I also have stddef.h there.

From [https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/vstudio/en-US/0f580a73-6f11-4aa6-abbe-6bf1438734c2/standard-files-stddefh-stringh-missing-in-visual-studio-2015-rc?forum=vclanguage](the topic you posted)

"The headers, sources, and libraries are now distributed as part of a separate
Universal CRT SDK. This SDK is included with Visual Studio; it is installed by
default to C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10."

I have installed Windows Kits v10 on my env. in the past, don't you have it? Visual Studio is ok on my env -except Tensorflow hundreds of different solution are building well there.

I am familiar with visual studio and MSBuild pretty well and maybe can find the core of problem with stddef.h. Does bazel invoke VS/msbuild internally during build? Can I reproduce this error with msbuild command?

I have tried to run configure on other env. And got other unclear error:

./configure
./configure: line 2: $'\r': command not found
./configure: line 4: $'\r': command not found
./configure: line 30: syntax error near unexpected token $'in\r'' '/configure: line 30: case $INPUT in

body:
<On my machine, stddef.h can be found at C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\Include\10.0.10240.0\ucrt
I also have stddef.h there.

From [https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/vstudio/en-US/0f580a73-6f11-4aa6-abbe-6bf1438734c2/standard-files-stddefh-stringh-missing-in-visual-studio-2015-rc?forum=vclanguage](the topic you posted)

> "The headers, sources, and libraries are now distributed as part of a separate 
> Universal CRT SDK. This SDK is included with Visual Studio; it is installed by 
> default to C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10."

I have installed Windows Kits v10 on my env. in the past, don't you have it? Visual Studio is ok on my env -except Tensorflow hundreds of different solution are building well there.

I am familiar with visual studio and MSBuild pretty well and maybe can find the core of problem with stddef.h. Does bazel invoke VS/msbuild internally during build? Can I reproduce this error with msbuild command? 



---

I have tried to run configure on other env. And got other unclear error:

./configure
./configure: line 2: $'\r': command not found
./configure: line 4: $'\r': command not found
./configure: line 30: syntax error near unexpected token `$'in\r''
'/configure: line 30: `  case $INPUT in
